transbit.tbits.api
Class APIUtil

java.lang.Object
  transbit.tbits.api.APIUtil
All Implemented Interfaces:
TBitsConstants
public class APIUtil
extends java.lang.Object
implements TBitsConstants

This class contains the static methods which are basically utilities used during request processing in the API.

Version:
: $Id: $
Author:
: Vaibhav.

          gives you a collection of RequestDataType objects from the hashtable the format of the keys in hashtable should be #[#] Although the method returns the HashSet concrete type but one should treat returned object to be a Collection only and not any specific type.
static java.util.Collection<RequestDataType> getRequestCollection(java.lang.String requests)
          gives you a collection of RequestDataType objects from the string the format of the string should be #[#][,#[#]] the separator ";" is also supported for separting two requests but should be avoided.

getTVNFileAction

@Deprecated
public static java.lang.String getTVNFileAction(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                                           java.lang.String attName,
                                                           java.lang.String systemPrefix,
                                                           int requestId)
                                         throws TBitsException
Deprecated. 

This method processes the attachment list. generates the requestFileId for the newly added attachments

Parameters:
aSysPrefix - Business area prefix.
aRequestId - Request Id.
aActionId - Action Id.
aUser - User
myAttachments - Comma separated list of attachment names.
aBmpToPng - Flag to say if conversion should happen.
aPrecision - Flag to say if precision is required.
fileResMgr - The resource manager which can help rolling back the file move operation.
Returns:
XML to represent the stored attachments.
Throws:
TBitsException
TBitsException - Incase of any errors.

getRequestCollection

public static java.util.Collection<RequestDataType> getRequestCollection(java.lang.String requests)
gives you a collection of RequestDataType objects from the string the format of the string should be #[#][,#[#]] the separator ";" is also supported for separting two requests but should be avoided. Although the method returns the HashSet concrete type but one should treat returned object to be a Collection only and not any specific type.

Parameters:
aRelatedRequests -
Returns:

compareFieldValueAndRuleValue

public static boolean compareFieldValueAndRuleValue(java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,Field> fieldsHashTable,
                                                    java.lang.String fieldName,
                                                    java.lang.String fieldValue,
                                                    java.lang.String ruleValue,
                                                    BusinessRule.Operator operator)
This method compares the following values of a field using the specified operator. - Value of the field in the request. - Value of the field specified in the rule.

Parameters:
fieldsHashTable - The table containing the fields definition.
fieldName - Name of the field.
ruleValue - Value specified by the rule.
operator - Operator to be applied.
Returns:
true if the comparison is successful.

cloneCollection

public static void cloneCollection(java.util.Collection src,
                                   java.util.Collection dest)
                            throws TBitsException
This method can be used to clone the Collection for one level of objects which are not container type Example it can do deep clone of Collection, or Collection but for objects like Collection> this will not do a deep clone. for such Collections you can create methods which uses this method multiple times for each Collection

Parameters:
src - : source Collection cannot be null
dest - : destination Collection cannot be null
Throws:
TBitsException - : in case where src or dest is null or clone is not implemented in the Collection objects or other problem.

cloneHashtable

public static void cloneHashtable(java.util.Hashtable src,
                                  java.util.Hashtable dest)
                           throws TBitsException
This method can be used to clone the Hashtable for one level of objects which are not container type, i.e. both key and value cannot be container type Example it can do deep clone of Hashtable, or Collection but for objects like Hashtable> this will NOT do a deep clone.As it will call the ArrayList.clone() for the value objects for such Hashtable you can create methods which uses this method and cloneCollection() for each Collection values.

Parameters:
src - : source Hashtable cannot be null
dest - : destination Hashtable cannot be null
Throws:
TBitsException - : in case where src or dest is null or clone is not implemented in the Hashtable key, values .. or other problem.
